p: The Monash Clinical Program is described to demonstrate the value of using a clinical best practices framework to guide the responses of clinical programmes to the challenges generated by COVID19. Research related to clinical best practices undertaken as part of the planning for implementation of the Monash Clinical Guarantee has shaped the programme’s response to the pandemic. The article then considers a range of issues generated by Monash’s move to virtual delivery of client services and the clinic’s teaching programme. The article concludes with contemplation of how clinical programmes can best plan for ‘the new normal’ that will present itself after the pandemic.
